Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSObservation

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSObservation 0..*EHDSDataSet
Elements defined in Ancestors:header, presentedForm
Observation model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
observationDate[x] 1..1Observation date
Binding Description: (preferred): LOINC, NPU, SNOMED CT
observationDateDateTimedateTime
observationDatePeriodPeriod
performer 0..1EHDSHealthProfessionalPerformer
reporter 0..1EHDSHealthProfessionalReporter
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Observation status
code 1..1CodeableConceptObservation code
observationMethod 0..1CodeableConceptObservation method
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
anatomicLocation 0..1CodeableConceptAnatomic location
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
observationResult 1..1BaseObservation result
value[x] 1..1Value or result of the observation
valueStringstring
valueQuantityQuantity
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
valueBooleanboolean
uncertainty 0..1QuantityUncertainty
dataAbsentReason 0..1CodeableConceptdataAbsentReason
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Data absent reason
referenceRange 0..*BaseReference range
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT, HL7 ObservationInterpretation
component 0..*BaseComponent
code 1..1CodeableConceptObservation code
result 1..1See observationResultObservation result
referenceRange 0..*BaseReference range
observationInterpretation 0..*CodeableConceptObservation interpretation
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT, HL7 ObservationInterpretation
hasMember 0..*Reference(Observation model)Has member
resultDescription 0..1stringResult description
observationInterpretation 0..*CodeableConceptObservation interpretation

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSObservation
title: Observation model
description: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data
Patient/subject information
Business identifier for the object
Resource authoring details
Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.
Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information
Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.
Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
Business version of the resource.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation.
Identifies the originator/author and provides provenance information about the source of the results data that may have not originated with the source of the whole Laboratory Report document.
With certain observation results, e.g. there may also be an interpreter or a person responsible for validation.
The status of the result.
Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.
Observation method (measurement principle) to obtain the result.
Anatomic location and laterality where the observation should be or was performed.

Result of the observation including text, quantity, coded and boolean results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

element.short: Value or result of the observation
element.definition: Value or result of the observation
Measurement uncertainty type and interval should be provided if needed.
Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types could by providedProvides guide for interpretation of result. Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.
Some observations have multiple component observations. These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.
Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.

Result of the observation including text, quantity, coded and boolean results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types could by providedProvides guide for interpretation of result. Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.
Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.
This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
Comments and narrative representation of the observation result and findings.
Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.
